TopicTitle: 1.0.2 no sound on Win 7 x64. Not Steam.

Articles.Content: Updated to 1.0.2 and now KSP is totally silent. Yes, I have checked my Windows mixer setting and all are at 100% and nothing is muted. I also checked KSP's audio settings, nothing set to zero there. I don't use Steam so that has nothing to do with it.

Please delete your settings.cfg Galane, see if that solves this.

If it does not, please see the support stickies.
Deleting the settings.cfg didn't get sound working. I've looked through the stickies and didn't find anything about sound not working. How about a specific pointer to troubleshooting this?

I tried https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/mats/windows_media_player_diagnostic which claimed to have found and fixed several problems but still no sound in KSP and Windows Media Player 12 won't play WAV, OGG, or MP3 yet WAV files play normally for UI events like error messages and when moving volume controls.

Something, somehow, somewhere has boogered *something* in the audio on my PC. Updating to the latest Realtek drivers released in April didn't change the problem either.
Hi again Galane, please post the logs from the game, your dxdgaig and settings.cfg

DXdiag claimed absolutely nothing was wrong. I downloaded the web install for DX11 and ran that to reinstall DirectX. Now all the sound works again.

Dunno why Microsoft removed the tests from DXdiag that actually test the video and audio. All it does in 11 is tell you information that may not be correct.
"Streamlining the OS" I guess, but anyway I'm glad it's fixed, your finding will help others with the same issue
